body:
For description of the issue, please see the screenshot attached in the imgur link.

After the latest update and windows update, I am running into a crazy looking convergence issue. I have restarted the computer, checked graphics drivers, changed ingame graphics.

The next thing I was thinking about doing is uninstalling and reinstalling, but would rather not do that unless it's a last resort. Any suggestions?

replies.body: Hi, try hitting ctrl+t in game.
Wow, that helped!! What is that command for?

First of all, thanks to Tseihei for helping a fellow player out with an issue! Second, that's a great question! To add further context to Tseihei's answer, Nvidia video cards have the ability to display games in 3D--this feature is called "3D Vision"--which creates the effect you've witnessed. With the proper equipment--like 3D glasses--things will look 3D (with assets being shown at different depths), but without it, you'll see split images layered over each other; this is also something you can witness if you go to a 3D movie, but don't wear the glasses.

Ctrl + T is a hotkey to toggle the 3D Vision feature on and off. As you've already hinted at in your first reply, there are some cases where 3D Vision automatically toggles on after a video card driver update. So the next time you update your video card drivers and notice that you're seeing layered duplicated images in-game, use the Ctrl + T hotkey to toggle the feature off.
Try pressing Ctrl T. It worked for me

Ctrl+t is to toggle 3d mode.
Have fun playing!
